previous.name: On the Bank of the Sutanu

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno sākete viharanti kaṇḍakīvane.
segments.en: At one time the venerables Anuruddha, Sāriputta, and Mahāmoggallāna were staying near Sāketa, in the Thorny Wood.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitā yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā anuruddhena saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna came out of retreat, went to Anuruddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side. Sāriputta said to Anuruddha:

segments.pli: “sekhenāvuso anuruddha, bhikkhunā katame dhammā upasampajja vihātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things should a trainee mendicant enter and remain in?”

segments.pli: “Sekhenāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā cattāro satipaṭṭhānā upasampajja vihātabbā.
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, a trainee mendicant should enter and remain in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ—
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: sekhenāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā ime cattāro satipaṭṭhānā upasampajja vihātabbā”ti.
segments.en: A trainee mendicant should enter and remain in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”

sections.title: At one time the venerables Anuruddha, Sāriputta, and Mahāmoggallāna…

suttaplex.blurb: Sāriputta and Moggallāna ask Anuruddha what a trainee mendicant should practice. He replies that it is the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
